posts.cooked:
Is there a way to set a single point that the robot goes to in pathPlanner autos instead of a whole path? I want the robot to go in front of the speaker, but the path I have to line up with the speaker makes the bot want to line up early. I want it to follow the blue line, but it follows the red line instead. image 935×647 65.5 KB

image 935×647 65.5 KB

image 935×647 65.5 KB

I was watching the Behind the Bumpers of 4481 Rembrandts and I saw that their pathplanner had straight lines that go to single points. How do I do this?

posts.name: Bjorn Janssen
posts.cooked:
I don’t know if this is the answer you’re looking for but I think that you should set the starting position of each path to the end position the previous path.

How the robot follows the path also depends on the path following algorithm you’re using. We recently switched from pure pursuit to a custom holonomic drive controller.

Honestly, our software team can give you a better advice @Jochem @Nigelientje

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked:
Can you share your code, or at least your paths and auto files? It’s not clear what you have going on from the screenshot. Is that a screenshot of an auto, with multiple paths? Do the paths each start and end at the same point?

When you create a path, you can change the heading and next control point to get the behavior you want between points in a path.

link_counts.title: Editing Paths and Autos | PathPlanner Docs

posts.name: Nigel
posts.cooked:
Sorry, Bjorn tagged us while we were traveling back from California to Eindhoven so I completely missed this.

Just to be clear, do you always want to go to the same coordinates, regardless of your robot starting position, or will the relative translation always be the same?

If it is the second option, then creating a path with a start and end point without any control points in between should suffice. Just make sure that the control points face eachother. This is (or at least was in 2023 and prior) different from your robot rotation.
I was wondering how to always go to the same coordinates regardless of starting position

posts.name: Tyler Olds
posts.cooked: Just want to say it’s awesome that you caught some of this on Behind the Bumpers. It’s difficult for us to tell sometimes when we try to record someone’s laptop if anything can be taken from it so this is good feedback for us.
you can find the repo here the screenshot is of an auto, and I don’t have the paths start where the previous one ends. I just let pathplanner interpolate between them lol

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked: You can chain them together and let PathPlanner solve it, but if you want more control the solution is to connect them. Connecting them will give you exactly what you’re looking for.
